summary: In this context, ammonia is mentioned in relation to its presence in digestate, which contains both volatile organic and inorganic compounds. The discussion highlights how ammonia can be stripped along with other compounds during the processing of low-ammonia food waste digestate. While ammonia is an inorganic compound, the context does not delve into specific interactions or detailed relationships between ammonia and the broader category of inorganic chemicals, limiting the depth of their connection.
